In this scenario, my own payoff is the same regardless of my choice. Thus, I can focus entirely on the outcome for Person A. Choosing "Right" gives Person A a significantly higher payoff (750) compared to choosing "Left" (400). Since my payoff remains constant, maximizing the benefit for the other person aligns with a general principle of promoting positive outcomes, which is analogous to my work in supporting healthy ecosystems. I would choose the option that leads to a greater good for the other person involved.

There is no reason, based on my persona, to choose the option that gives Person A less money, given that it does not negatively impact my own payoff.
